sentences.english: The disharmony of qi and blood may cause various diseases.
sentences.chinese: 气血不和，百病乃变化而生。

sentences.english: I went to the hospital, give each of the magic of the doctor can cure all ills.
sentences.chinese: 我来到医院，给予每位医生能治百病的魔力。

sentences.english: Not born all ills, without a prescription.
Any medical equipment are not a panacea, including high potential into account.
sentences.chinese: 任何医疗器械都不可能包治百病，包括高电位在内。

sentences.english: I really don't think there is one way to do it.
sentences.chinese: 我认为没有哪种方法可以包治百病。

sentences.english: Incorrect posture is not only unsightly, but is the cause of all kinds of disorders.
sentences.chinese: 不正确的姿势，不但难看，而且会导致百病丛生。

sentences.english: The salesman proclaimed that his tonic would cure all ills.
sentences.chinese: 销售商说他的补药能医百病。

sentences.english: “The Emperor of All Maladies” is a history of eureka moments and decades of despair.
sentences.chinese: 《百病之王》是灵感瞬间迸发和几十年失望的历史。

sentences.english: Mr. Kennedy, the Indiana University expert, said he was less certain that endless growth is such a panacea.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪表示，无休止的经济增长并不能包治百病。

sentences.english: The tonic is believed to be an all-purpose cure for everything from asthma to liver disease.
sentences.chinese: 这种补酒据说包治百病，包括哮喘和肝病。

sentences.english: He said the queen had given him as a sovereign remedy in all disorders.
sentences.chinese: 他说王后给他的是能治百病的妙药。

sentences.english: Happiness is like a spring, which makes your hundreds of illness recovery and thousands of worry abreaction.
sentences.chinese: 幸福就像温泉，身处其中让你百病痊愈，千愁消散。

sentences.english: Dew collected during Midsummer is believed to have special healing powers.
sentences.chinese: 而在夏至日收集的露水被认为能治百病。

sentences.english: Even the best-laid plans will not be a miracle cure.
sentences.chinese: 即使是最完善的计划也不会是包治百病的灵丹妙药。

definition: traditional Chinese medical science/a doctor trained in Chinese medicine

(TCM) six bowels (hollow organs), namely: gall bladder 膽|胆[dan3], stomach 胃[wei4], large intestine 大腸|大肠[da4 chang2], small intestine 小腸|小肠[xiao3 chang2], triple heater 三焦[san1 jiao1], bladder 膀胱[pang2 guang1]
to make life longer/to promise longevity/(this product will) extend your life
five viscera of TCM, namely: heart 心[xin1], liver 肝[gan1], spleen 脾[pi2], lungs 肺[fei4] and kidneys 腎|肾[shen4]
The Yellow Emperor's Internal Canon, medical text c. 300 BC
spleen and stomach (digestive organs in TCM)/preferences/one's taste (e.g. in literature)
qi and blood (two basic bodily fluids of Chinese medicine)
the way of maintaining good health
lit. the disease is cured the moment the medicine is taken (idiom)/fig. (of a medical treatment) to give instant results/(of a solution or method) highly effective
